DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to design, refine, and test for the effectiveness of a computer-based telephone system (Telephone-Linked Communications for Detection of Mental Health Disorders in the Workplace; TLC-Detect) that will screen workers for mental health distress; educate them about seeking treatment; and follow up with them over a 6 month period.
DOC.brief_title: Automated Assessment of Mental Health in the Workplace
DOC.criteria: Employment with benefits at Boston Medical Center, Boston University, or Florida Power and Light Company Ability to speak and understand conversational English > 18 years of age Access to a touchtone telephone Screen positive for the World Health Organization (WHO)5 WellBeing Index Being under treatment (medication or therapy) for a mental health disorder Taking medication for a serious/major medical disorder that interferes with normal life Taking medication prescribed for mental health treatment on a daily basis Diagnosed with schizophrenia Planning to go on leave for over 6 months
